param.name: Blimp:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: Blimp:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: Blimp:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_THR_FILT
param.documentation: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_TKOFF_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude that altitude control modes will climb to when a takeoff is triggered with the throttle stick.

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_THR_BHV
param.documentation: Bitmask containing various throttle stick options. TX with sprung throttle can set PILOT_THR_BHV to "1" so motor feedback when landed starts from mid-stick instead of bottom of stick.
param.field: 0:Feedback from mid stick,1:High throttle cancels landing,2:Disarm on land detection

param.name: Blimp:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: Blimp:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: Blimp:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds. See FS_OPTIONS param for additional actions, or for cases allowing Mission continuation, when GCS failsafe is enabled.

param.name: Blimp:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: Blimp:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

param.name: Blimp:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level in microseconds on channel 3 below which throttle failsafe triggers

param.name: Blimp:THR_DZ
param.documentation: The deadzone above and below mid throttle in PWM microseconds. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: Blimp:FLTMODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

param.name: Blimp:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot.

param.name: Blimp:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Bitmap of what log types to enable in on-board logger. This value is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved. On boards supporting microSD cards or other large block-storage devices it is usually best just to enable all basic log types by setting this to 65535.
param.field: 0:Fast Attitude,1:Medium Attitude,2:GPS,3:System Performance,4:Control Tuning,6:RC Input,7:IMU,9:Battery Monitor,10:RC Output,11:Optical Flow,12:PID,13:Compass

param.name: Blimp:DISARM_DELAY
param.documentation: Delay before automatic disarm in seconds. A value of zero disables auto disarm.

param.name: Blimp:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: Blimp:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: Blimp:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

param.name: Blimp:MAX_VEL_XY
param.documentation: Sets the maximum XY velocity, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_VEL_Z
param.documentation: Sets the maximum Z velocity, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_VEL_YAW
param.documentation: Sets the maximum yaw velocity, in rad/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_POS_XY
param.documentation: Sets the maximum XY position change, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_POS_Z
param.documentation: Sets the maximum Z position change, in m/s

param.name: Blimp:MAX_POS_YAW
param.documentation: Sets the maximum Yaw position change, in rad/s

param.name: Blimp:SIMPLE_MODE
param.documentation: Simple mode for Position control - "forward" moves blimp in +ve X direction world-frame

param.name: Blimp:DIS_MASK
param.documentation: Mask for disabling one or more of the 4 output axis in mode Velocity or Loiter

param.name: Blimp:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_D
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:VELXY_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_I
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_D
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:VELZ_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_P
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_I
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_D
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:VELYAW_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (yaw) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_P
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_I
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_D
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in position

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_FLTE
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_FLTD
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:POSXY_FF
param.documentation: Position (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_I
param.documentation: Position (vertical) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_D
param.documentation: Position (vertical) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in position

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Position (vertical) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Position (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Position (vertical) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Blimp:POSZ_FF
param.documentation: Position (vertical) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired position to a target velocity

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_P
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller P gain.

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_I
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller I gain.

param.humanName: Position (yaw) axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller I gain maximum.

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_D
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller D gain.

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FF
param.documentation: Position (yaw) axis controller feed forward

param.humanName: Position (yaw) target frequency filter in Hz
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FLTT
param.documentation: Position (yaw) target frequency filter in Hz

param.humanName: Position (yaw) error frequency filter in Hz
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FLTE
param.documentation: Position (yaw) error frequency filter in Hz

param.humanName: Position (yaw) derivative input filter in Hz
param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_FLTD
param.documentation: Position (yaw) derivative input filter in Hz

param.name: Blimp:POSYAW_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains.

param.name: Blimp:DEV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of developer options. The meanings of the bit fields in this parameter may vary at any time. Developers should check the source code for current meaning

param.name: Blimp:SYSID_ENFORCE
param.documentation: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

param.name: Blimp:FRAME_CLASS
param.documentation: Controls major frame class for blimp.

param.name: Blimp:PILOT_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: The maximum vertical descending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: Blimp:FS_VIBE_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the vibration failsafe which will use modified altitude estimation and control during high vibrations

param.name: Blimp:FS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of additional options for battery, radio, & GCS failsafes. 0 (default) disables all options.
param.field: 4:Continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe

values.value: Continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe

param.name: Blimp:FS_GCS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Timeout before triggering the GCS failsafe

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.humanName: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down
param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.

values.value: Use GPS for DCM position and height

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_MAX_WIND to disable airspeed sensors.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for AHRS orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_ROT1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_ROT2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AIS_TYPE
param.documentation: AIS receiver type

param.name: AIS_LIST_MAX
param.documentation: AIS list size of nearest vessels. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

param.name: AIS_TIME_OUT
param.documentation: if no updates are received in this time a vessel will be removed from the list

param.name: AIS_LOGGING
param.documentation: Bitmask of AIS logging options
param.field: 0:Log all AIVDM messages,1:Log only unsupported AIVDM messages,2:Log decoded messages

param.name: ARMING_ACCTHRESH
param.documentation: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

param.name: ARMING_RUDDER
param.documentation: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works in manual throttle modes with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ)

param.name: ARMING_MIS_ITEMS
param.documentation: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

param.name: ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 1 (all checks enabled). You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72.
param.field: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration,13:System,14:Mission,15:Rangefinder,16:Camera,17:AuxAuth,18:VisualOdometry,19:FFT

param.name: ARMING_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options that can be applied to change arming behaviour

param.name: ARSPD_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: ARSPD_USE
param.documentation: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.name: ARSPD_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD_RATIO
param.documentation: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

param.name: ARSPD_PIN
param.documentation: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port.

param.humanName: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
param.name: ARSPD_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: Enables automatic adjustment of ARSPD_RATIO during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

param.name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
param.name: ARSPD_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device
param.name: ARSPD_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

param.name: ARSPD_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

param.name: ARSPD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.humanName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.humanName: Airspeed and ground speed difference that gives a warning
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_WARN
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.name: ARSPD_WIND_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle.

param.name: ARSPD_OFF_PCNT
param.documentation: The maximum percentage speed change in airspeed reports that is allowed due to offset changes between calibraions before a warning is issued. This potential speed error is in percent of ASPD_FBW_MIN. 0 disables. Helps warn of calibrations without pitot being covered.

param.name: ARSPD2_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of 2nd airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD2_USE
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.name: ARSPD2_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD2_RATIO
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration ratio

param.name: ARSPD2_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number indicating location of analog airspeed sensors. Pixhawk/Cube if set to 15.

param.humanName: Automatic airspeed ratio calibration for 2nd airspeed sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

param.humanName: Control pitot tube order of 2nd airspeed sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup for 2nd sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device for 2nd sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD2_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

param.name: ARSPD2_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO1_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO_GND_TEMP
param.documentation: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

param.name: BARO_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: BARO_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

param.name: BARO_EXT_BUS
param.documentation: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the BARO_PROBE_EXT parameter.

param.name: BARO2_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO3_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: BARO_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: BARO_PROBE_EXT
param.documentation: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on BARO_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in BARO_EXT_BUS.

param.name: BARO1_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO2_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO3_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO_FIELD_ELV
param.documentation: User provided field elevation in meters. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means no correction for takeoff height above sea level is performed.

param.name: BARO_ALTERR_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum acceptable altitude discrepancy between GPS altitude and barometric presssure altitude calculated against a standard atmosphere for arming checks to pass. If you are getting an arming error due to this parameter then you may have a faulty or substituted barometer. A common issue is vendors replacing a MS5611 in a "Pixhawk" with a MS5607. If you have that issue then please see BARO_OPTIONS parameter to force the MS5611 to be treated as a MS5607. This check is disabled if the value is zero.

param.name: BARO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Barometer options

param.name: BARO1_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_UP
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_DN
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT2_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor
param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT2_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT2_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT2_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT2_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT2_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT2_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

param.name: BATT2_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT3_MONITOR

param.name: BATT3_CAPACITY

param.name: BATT5_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT5_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT5_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT5_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT5_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT5_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT5_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT5_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT5_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT5_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT5_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

param.name: BATT5_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT6_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT6_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT6_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT6_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT6_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT6_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT6_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT6_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT6_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT6_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT6_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT6__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor
param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS

param.name: BATT_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor
param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS

param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

param.name: BATT_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

param.name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER3_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 3. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER4_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER5_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 5. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.humanName: Sets default state of the safety switch
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_DEFLT
param.documentation: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

param.name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

param.name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

param.humanName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

param.name: BRD_HEAT_TARG
param.documentation: Board heater target temperature for boards with controllable heating units. DO NOT SET to -1 on the Cube. Set to -1 to disable the heater, please reboot after setting to -1.

param.name: BRD_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

param.name: BRD_IO_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows for the IO co-processor on boards with an IOMCU to be disabled. Setting to 2 will enable the IOMCU but not attempt to update firmware on startup

param.name: BRD_SAFETYOPTION
param.documentation: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed
param.field: 0:ActiveForSafetyEnable,1:ActiveForSafetyDisable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

param.name: BRD_VBUS_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_VSERVO_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN
param.documentation: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

param.name: BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL
param.documentation: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

param.name: BRD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Board specific option flags
param.field: 0:Enable hardware watchdog, 1:Disable MAVftp, 2:Enable set of internal parameters, 3:Enable Debug Pins, 4:Unlock flash on reboot, 5:Write protect firmware flash on reboot, 6:Write protect bootloader flash on reboot

param.name: BRD_BOOT_DELAY
param.documentation: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

param.name: BRD_HEAT_P
param.documentation: Board Heater P gain

param.name: BRD_HEAT_I
param.documentation: Board Heater integrator gain

param.name: BRD_HEAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Board Heater integrator maximum

param.name: BRD_ALT_CONFIG
param.documentation: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

param.name: BRD_HEAT_LOWMGN
param.documentation: Arming check will fail if temp is lower than this margin below BRD_HEAT_TARG. 0 disables the low temperature check

param.humanName: Set type of direct attached radio
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TYPE
param.documentation: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PROT
param.documentation: Select air protocol

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DEBUG
param.documentation: radio debug level

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DISCRC
param.documentation: disable receive CRC (for debug)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_SIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TELEM
param.documentation: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXPOW
param.documentation: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

param.humanName: Put radio into FCC test mode
param.name: BRD_RADIO_FCCTST
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_STKMD
param.documentation: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

param.humanName: Set radio to factory test channel
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TESTCH
param.documentation: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

param.humanName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXMAX
param.documentation: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_BZOFS
param.documentation: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABTIME
param.documentation: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABLVL
param.documentation: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

param.name: BRD_RTC_TYPES
param.documentation: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

param.name: BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN
param.documentation: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

param.name: CAM_RC_TYPE
param.documentation: RunCam deviee type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

param.name: CAM_RC_FEATURES
param.documentation: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.
param.field: 0:Power Button,1:WiFi Button,2:Change Mode,3:5-Key OSD,4:Settings Access,5:DisplayPort,6:Start Recording,7:Stop Recording

param.humanName: RunCam boot delay before allowing updates
param.name: CAM_RC_BT_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.humanName: RunCam button delay before allowing further button presses
param.name: CAM_RC_BTN_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.humanName: RunCam mode delay before allowing further button presses
param.name: CAM_RC_MDE_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.name: CAM_RC_CONTROL
param.documentation: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu
param.field: 0:Stick yaw right,1:Stick roll right,2:3-position switch,3:2-position switch,4:Autorecording enabled

param.name: CAN_LOGLEVEL
param.documentation: Loglevel for recording initialisation and debug information from CAN Interface

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ECU_ID
param.documentation: Node ID to send ECU throttle messages to. Set to zero to disable ECU throttle messages. Set to 255 to broadcast to all ECUs.

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ECU_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ECU command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_TST_ID
param.documentation: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

param.name: CAN_D1_TST_LPR8
param.documentation: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16, 16: Servo 17, 17: Servo 18, 18: Servo 19, 19: Servo 20, 20: Servo 21, 21: Servo 22, 22: Servo 23, 23: Servo 24, 24: Servo 25, 25: Servo 26, 26: Servo 27, 27: Servo 28, 28: Servo 29, 29: Servo 30, 30: Servo 31, 31: Servo 32

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_OPTION
param.documentation: Option flags

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NTF_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_OF
param.documentation: Offset for ESC numbering in DroneCAN ESC RawCommand messages. This allows for more efficient packing of ESC command messages. If your ESCs are on servo functions 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. This can be used for more efficint usage of CAN bandwidth

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_POOL
param.documentation: Amount of memory in bytes to allocate for the DroneCAN memory pool. More memory is needed for higher CAN bus loads

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D2_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_ECU_ID
param.documentation: Node ID to send ECU throttle messages to. Set to zero to disable ECU throttle messages. Set to 255 to broadcast to all ECUs.

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_ECU_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ECU command messages

param.name: CAN_D2_TST_ID
param.documentation: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

param.name: CAN_D2_TST_LPR8
param.documentation: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16, 16: Servo 17, 17: Servo 18, 18: Servo 19, 19: Servo 20, 20: Servo 21, 21: Servo 22, 22: Servo 23, 23: Servo 24, 24: Servo 25, 25: Servo 26, 26: Servo 27, 27: Servo 28, 28: Servo 29, 29: Servo 30, 30: Servo 31, 31: Servo 32

param.humanName: Output channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN

param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.name: CAN_D2_UC_OPTION
param.documentation: Option flags

param.name: CAN_D2_UC_NTF_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

If your ESCs are on servo functions 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. This can be used for more efficint usage of CAN bandwidth

param.name: CAN_D3_PROTOCOL

param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_RT

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_NODE

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16, 16: Servo 17, 17: Servo 18, 18: Servo 19, 19: Servo 20, 20: Servo 21, 21: Servo 22, 22: Servo 23, 23: Servo 24, 24: Servo 25, 25: Servo 26, 26: Servo 27, 27: Servo 28, 28: Servo 29, 29: Servo 30, 30: Servo 31, 31: Servo 32

If your ESCs are on servo functions 5 to 8 and you set this parameter to 4 then the ESC RawCommand will be sent with the first 4 slots filled. This can be used for more efficint usage of CAN bandwidth

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P1_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P1_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_P1_FDBITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P2_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P2_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_P2_FDBITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P3_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P3_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_P3_FDBITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_CPORT
param.documentation: CAN Interface ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM
param.documentation: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT
param.documentation: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original driver in seconds.

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SDELAY
param.documentation: Duration after which slcan starts after setting SERNUM in seconds.

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the COMPASS_CUS_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for Compass orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID2
param.documentation: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID3
param.documentation: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_USE2
param.documentation: Enable or disable the secondary compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT2
param.documentation: The orientation of a second external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the COMPASS_CUS_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for Compass orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERN2
param.documentation: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_USE3
param.documentation: Enable or disable the tertiary compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT3
param.documentation: The orientation of a third external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the COMPASS_CUS_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for Compass orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERN3
param.documentation: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_Y

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_Z

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_X

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_X

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_Z
