param.name: LOG_BACKEND_TYPE
param.documentation: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

param.humanName: Maximum AP_Logger File and Block Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)
param.name: LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE
param.documentation: The File and Block backends use a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.

param.name: LOG_DISARMED
param.documentation: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

param.humanName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay
param.name: LOG_REPLAY
param.documentation: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost

param.humanName: Stop logging to current file on disarm
param.name: LOG_FILE_DSRMROT
param.documentation: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed. If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened. Applies to the File and Block logging backends.

param.humanName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size
param.name: LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE
param.documentation: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink

param.humanName: Timeout before giving up on file writes
param.name: LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.

param.humanName: Old logs on the SD card will be deleted to maintain this amount of free space
param.name: LOG_FILE_MB_FREE
param.documentation: Set this such that the free space is larger than your largest typical flight log

param.humanName: Maximum logging rate for file backend
param.name: LOG_FILE_RATEMAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the file backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.

param.humanName: Maximum logging rate for mavlink backend
param.name: LOG_MAV_RATEMAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.

param.humanName: Maximum logging rate for block backend
param.name: LOG_BLK_RATEMAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.

param.name: MSP_OSD_NCELLS
param.documentation: Used for average cell voltage calculation

param.name: MSP_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A bitmask to set some MSP specific options

param.name: NTF_LED_BRIGHT
param.documentation: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_TYPES
param.documentation: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

param.humanName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed
param.name: NTF_LED_OVERRIDE
param.documentation: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED. OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.

param.name: NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE
param.documentation: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

param.name: NTF_OREO_THEME
param.documentation: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_PIN
param.documentation: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET! Some the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

param.name: NTF_LED_TYPES
param.documentation: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled
param.field: 0:Built-in LED, 1:Internal ToshibaLED, 2:External ToshibaLED, 3:External PCA9685, 4:Oreo LED, 5:DroneCAN, 6:NCP5623 External, 7:NCP5623 Internal, 8:NeoPixel, 9:ProfiLED, 10:Scripting, 11:DShot, 12:ProfiLED_SPI

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL
param.documentation: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME
param.documentation: Control the volume of the buzzer

param.name: NTF_LED_LEN
param.documentation: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

param.name: RC_OVERRIDE_TIME
param.documentation: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

param.name: RC_OPTIONS
param.documentation: RC input options
param.field: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe bit but allow other RC failsafes if setup, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yaw sticks, 7:Allow Switch reverse, 8:Use passthrough for CRSF telemetry, 9:Suppress CRSF mode/rate message for ELRS systems,10:Enable multiple receiver support, 11:CRSF RSSI shows Link Quality, 12:CRSF flight mode disarm star

param.name: RC_PROTOCOLS
param.documentation: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

param.name: RC_FS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: RC failsafe will trigger this many seconds after loss of RC

param.name: RC4_DZ

param.name: RC4_OPTION

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RSSI_TYPE
param.documentation: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

param.name: RSSI_ANA_PIN
param.documentation: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

param.name: RSSI_PIN_LOW
param.documentation: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

param.name: RSSI_PIN_HIGH
param.documentation: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

param.name: RSSI_CHANNEL
param.documentation: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_LOW
param.documentation: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_HIGH
param.documentation: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: SCHED_LOOP_RATE
param.documentation: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

param.name: SCHED_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

param.name: SCR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls if scripting is enabled

param.name: SCR_VM_I_COUNT
param.documentation: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

param.name: SCR_HEAP_SIZE
param.documentation: Amount of memory available for scripting

param.name: SCR_DEBUG_OPTS
param.documentation: Debugging options
param.field: 0:No Scripts to run message if all scripts have stopped, 1:Runtime messages for memory usage and execution time, 2:Suppress logging scripts to dataflash, 3:log runtime memory usage and execution time, 4:Disable pre-arm check

param.name: SCR_USER1
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER2
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER6
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_DIR_DISABLE
param.documentation: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

param.name: SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL0_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the console.

param.name: SERIAL1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL1_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate

param.name: SERIAL2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate

param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate

param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate

param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate

param.name: SERIAL_PASS1
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASS2
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASSTIMO
param.documentation: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

param.name: SERVO_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_ESC
param.documentation: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

param.name: SERVO_GPIO_MASK
param.documentation: This sets a bitmask of outputs which will be available as GPIOs. Any output with either the function set to -1 or with the corresponding bit set in this mask will be available for use as a GPIO pin

param.name: SERVO_32_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows for up to 32 outputs, enabling parameters for outputs above 16

param.name: SERVO10_MIN
param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_MAX
param.documentation: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_TRIM
param.documentation: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

param.name: SERVO10_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)
param.field: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32

param.humanName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors
param.name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
param.documentation: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
param.documentation: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
param.documentation: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

param.name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
param.documentation: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
param.documentation: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
param.documentation: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction
param.field: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32

param.humanName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels
param.name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.
param.field: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32

param.name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode
param.field: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32

param.name: SERVO_FTW_MASK
param.documentation: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

param.name: SERVO_FTW_RVMASK
param.documentation: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

param.name: SERVO_FTW_POLES
param.documentation: Number of motor electrical poles

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
param.documentation: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
param.documentation: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

param.name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

param.name: TEMP_LOG
param.documentation: Enables temperature sensor logging

param.name: TEMP1_TYPE
param.documentation: Enables temperature sensors

param.name: TEMP1_BUS
param.documentation: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

param.name: TEMP1_ADDR
param.documentation: Temperature sensor address, typically used for I2C address

param.name: TEMP1_SRC
param.documentation: Sensor Source is used to match up the source of the temperature data and populate the appropriate system-component. If 0 (None) then the data is only available via log.

param.name: TEMP1_SRC_ID
param.documentation: Sensor Source Identification is used to populate a specific instance of a system component. Examples: TEMP_SRC = 1 (ESC), TEMP_SRC_INDEX = 1 will set the temp of ESC1. TEMP_SRC = 3 (BatteryIndex),TEMP_SRC_INDEX=2 will set the temp of BATT2. TEMP_SRC = 4 (BatteryId?SerialNum),TEMP_SRC_INDEX=42 will set the temp of all batteries that have param BATTn_SERIAL = 42.

param.name: VISO_TYPE
param.documentation: Visual odometry camera connection type

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera X position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: VISO_ORIENT
param.documentation: Visual odometery camera orientation

param.name: VISO_SCALE
param.documentation: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

param.name: VISO_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

param.name: VISO_VEL_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

param.name: VISO_POS_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.name: VISO_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.humanName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not
param.name: VTX_ENABLE
param.documentation: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off

param.name: VTX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

param.name: VTX_CHANNEL
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Channel

param.name: VTX_BAND
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Band

param.name: VTX_FREQ
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

param.name: VTX_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels. One stop-bit may be required for VTXs that erroneously mimic iNav behaviour.
param.field: 0:Pitmode,1:Pitmode until armed,2:Pitmode when disarmed,3:Unlocked,4:Add leading zero byte to requests,5:Use 1 stop-bit in SmartAudio,6:Ignore CRC in SmartAudio,7:Ignore status updates in CRSF and blindly set VTX options

param.name: VTX_MAX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.
